definitions: philosophical belief that opposes war and violence as means of settling disputes between people or nations
examples: His commitment to pacifism led him to refuse military service
The movement promoted pacifism as an alternative to armed conflict

definitions: person who believes in and practices the principle of non-violence in resolving conflicts
examples: The pacifist refused to carry weapons during wartime
Many pacifists joined the peace demonstration downtown

definitions: rate at which something happens or develops over time
repeated walking back and forth in a confined space
examples: The pacing of the movie kept audiences engaged throughout
The director adjusted the pacing to build more suspense
His nervous pacing wore a path in the carpet
The expectant father's pacing annoyed everyone in the waiting room

definitions: materials used to wrap or protect goods for storage or sale
way something is presented to make it attractive or acceptable
examples: The packaging was made from recycled materials
Excessive packaging contributes to environmental waste
The candidate's packaging by consultants improved her image
Marketing focuses heavily on product packaging and presentation

definitions: worker who prepares goods for shipping by wrapping and boxing them
company that processes and packages products, especially meat or produce
examples: The packer carefully wrapped each fragile item
Warehouse packers worked overtime during the holiday season
The meat packer operated several processing plants
Local packers supply fresh produce to grocery stores

definitions: small container or envelope holding a portion of something
unit of data transmitted over a computer network
examples: She opened a packet of sugar for her coffee
The seed packet contained planting instructions
The network dropped several data packets during transmission
Each packet contains routing information in its header

definitions: process of putting things into containers for storage or transport
material used to protect items or fill spaces during shipping
examples: Packing for the move took three full days
She started packing her suitcase the night before
The fragile vase needed extra packing around it
Foam packing prevented damage during shipment

definitions: formal agreement between two or more parties to do or not do something
examples: The countries signed a non-aggression pact
They made a pact to meet every year

definitions: soft material used to protect, shape, or add comfort to something
unnecessary material added to make something seem larger or longer
examples: The helmet's padding absorbed the impact
Extra padding in the shoes provided comfort
The report contained too much padding and repetition
Remove the padding to make your essay more concise

definitions: short pole with a broad flat end used for propelling small boats
wooden or plastic bat used in table tennis or similar games
examples: She dipped the paddle into the calm water
The canoe came with two wooden paddles
His table tennis paddle had a special rubber surface
The paddle slipped from her grip during the match

definitions: small field or enclosure where horses are kept or exercised
examples: The horses grazed peacefully in the paddock
She led the mare from the stable to the paddock

definitions: flooded field where rice is grown in warm climates
examples: Farmers worked in the paddy under the hot sun
The paddy fields stretched to the horizon

definitions: detachable lock with a hinged or sliding shackle that passes through a staple
examples: He secured the gate with a heavy padlock
The padlock on the shed was rusty

definitions: medical doctor who specializes in the care and treatment of infants, children, and adolescents
examples: The paediatrician examined the baby's development
Parents trust their paediatrician for vaccination advice

definitions: adult who is sexually attracted to children and may act on these feelings illegally
examples: The convicted paedophile was sent to prison
Online safety programs warn children about paedophiles

definitions: person who follows a polytheistic or nature-worshipping religion outside mainstream religions
examples: The pagan celebrated the summer solstice
Ancient pagan rituals honored natural cycles

definitions: religious beliefs and practices that worship multiple deities or nature, outside mainstream religions
examples: Modern paganism has revived ancient traditions
The scholar studied paganism in pre-Christian Europe

definitions: elaborate public display or ceremony with people in costume
competition where contestants are judged on appearance and talent
examples: The historical pageant recreated medieval life
Hundreds participated in the Christmas pageant
She won the local beauty pageant last year
The pageant included evening gown and talent competitions

definitions: elaborate display or ceremony involving costumes and formal proceedings intended to impress
examples: The coronation featured traditional royal pageantry
Military pageantry marked the state visit

definitions: small electronic device that receives and displays numeric or text messages
examples: Doctors still carry pagers in many hospitals
His pager beeped with an urgent message

definitions: system for notifying or summoning someone, especially through loudspeakers
computer memory management technique that stores and retrieves data from secondary storage
examples: The hospital's paging system called the doctor
Airport paging announced the final boarding call
Virtual memory uses paging to manage RAM efficiently
The operating system handles paging automatically

definitions: tiered tower with multiple eaves common in Asian architecture, often religious
examples: The ancient pagoda stood five stories tall
Tourists photographed the golden pagoda at sunset

definitions: round container with a handle used for carrying liquids or other materials
examples: She carried water from the well in a pail
The child filled her pail with sand

definitions: medication taken to relieve physical pain in the body
examples: The doctor prescribed a strong painkiller
Over-the-counter painkillers helped her headache

definitions: competitive team sport where players shoot capsules of paint at each other
examples: They played paintball for his birthday party
Protective gear is essential for paintball games

definitions: brush with bristles used for applying paint to surfaces
examples: The artist selected a fine paintbrush for details
Clean your paintbrush thoroughly after each use

definitions: act of putting two things together as a complementary or matching set
examples: The wine pairing enhanced each course perfectly
The pairing of the actors created great chemistry

definitions: distinctive pattern of curved teardrop shapes originally from Persian and Indian designs
examples: Her paisley scarf added color to her outfit
The vintage paisley print was making a comeback

definitions: loose-fitting garments worn for sleeping, typically consisting of pants and a shirt
examples: He changed into his pajama set before bed
The silk pajama felt luxurious against her skin

definitions: upper surface of the mouth that separates oral and nasal cavities
person's ability to distinguish between and appreciate different flavors
examples: The hot pizza burned the roof of his palate
The dentist examined her palate for abnormalities
The wine suited his sophisticated palate perfectly
Children often have limited palates for new foods

definitions: scientist who studies prehistoric life through the examination of plant and animal fossils
examples: The paleontologist discovered dinosaur bones in the desert
Young paleontologists learn excavation techniques in the field

definitions: scientific study of prehistoric life through fossils and other remains preserved in rock
examples: Her passion for paleontology began with childhood dinosaur books
Modern paleontology uses advanced dating techniques

definitions: flat board on which an artist mixes paints
range of colors used in a particular work or available to an artist
examples: The painter mixed colors on her wooden palette
He cleaned his palette after each painting session
The designer chose an earth-tone palette for the room
The film's color palette created a somber mood

definitions: word, phrase, or sequence that reads the same backward as forward
examples: The word 'radar' is a simple palindrome
She enjoyed creating palindrome puzzles for her students

definitions: fence of wooden stakes or iron railings fixed in the ground to form a defensive barrier
examples: The fort's palisade protected settlers from attacks
They built a palisade around the camp

definitions: cloth spread over a coffin, hearse, or tomb
dark cloud of smoke, dust, or gloom that covers or hangs over something
examples: The flag served as a pall over the coffin
Mourners helped carry the pall into the church
A pall of smoke hung over the burning building
The news cast a pall over the celebration

definitions: rare silvery-white metallic element used in electronics, dentistry, and jewelry
examples: Palladium prices rose due to industrial demand
The catalytic converter contained palladium

definitions: flat transport structure that supports goods for lifting by forklift
simple bed made of straw or a pad on the floor
examples: The warehouse stored boxes on wooden pallets
Forklifts moved pallets of merchandise efficiently
Refugees slept on pallets in the shelter
He made a pallet on the floor for camping

definitions: medical care focused on providing relief from symptoms and stress of serious illness without curing
examples: The hospice provided palliative care for terminal patients
Palliative treatments improved her quality of life significantly

definitions: horse with a golden or cream-colored coat and white mane and tail
examples: The palomino galloped across the meadow gracefully
She dreamed of owning a palomino horse

definitions: medical condition involving paralysis or uncontrollable shaking of part of the body
examples: Cerebral palsy affected his motor skills from birth
The doctor explained different types of palsy

definitions: small booklet containing information or arguments about a single subject
examples: The clinic distributed health pamphlets to patients
Political pamphlets littered the town before elections

definitions: solution or remedy claimed to solve all problems or cure all diseases
examples: There's no panacea for economic problems
Some view technology as a panacea for education

definitions: distinctive and stylish elegance or flamboyant confidence in manner or appearance
examples: She performed the routine with incredible panache
His panache made him stand out at parties

definitions: thin, flat cake made from batter and cooked on a griddle
examples: She topped her pancake with maple syrup
The diner served fluffy pancakes all day

definitions: large bear native to China with distinctive black and white markings
examples: The giant panda munched bamboo at the zoo
Conservation efforts have helped panda populations recover

definitions: disease outbreak that spreads across large regions or worldwide affecting many people
examples: The pandemic changed how people work and socialize
Historical pandemics have shaped human civilization
